meanings.sent1: After climbing the tree, he ended up refalling to the ground.
meanings.sent2: She kept refalling on the slippery ice despite her efforts to stay upright.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy cat was refalling off the couch repeatedly, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: His grades were refalling like leaves in autumn, dropping lower each week.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge was so worn out that it seemed to be refalling apart with each passing day.

meanings.sent1: The refalling of the leaves in the wind created a beautiful dance of colors.
meanings.sent2: The refalling of the snow made the landscape look like a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent3: The refalling of the raindrops on the window sounded like a soothing melody.
meanings.sent4: The refalling of the prices at the store brought joy to the shoppers.
meanings.sent5: The refalling of the petals from the flower made the garden look magical.
